job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in Irvine, CA
pros:
They really work to make CIU the best place to work. 
There's an incredible Teamwork sense and idea. 
Managers are approachable and they are always motivating you to do better.
cons: No cons, honestly. I'm in love with my job and the place where I work.

pros: The leadership team is approachable and supportive, and there are ample opportunities for professional development and growth. Additionally, the organization is constantly seeking feedback from employees and implementing changes to improve the workplace.
cons: There may be some room for improvement in communication between departments but the Univ values its employees and is dedicated to providing an exceptional educational experience to its students.

pros: Online so its a bit more flexible
cons: Curriculum is terrible Pay is not much better

job_title: Too Small of A Company to Say in Irvine, CA
cons:
-Ridiculously high turnover
-Claims they have a "startup culture", but that is just an excuse to assign an unachievable amount of work
-Will be messaged at all hours of the day, and expected to answer
-Many employees have been fired and their jobs have been outsourced
- There is no advancement opportunities

job_title: Student Success Architect in Irvine, CA
pros: CIU has an outstanding organizational culture and an exceptional support system. All Staff and Faculty members strive toward the same goal, making excellent student service a priority. The culture at CIU is friendly, supportive, and unanimous. Team members are ready to help one another, and conflict is minimal. Management is always open to new ideas that contribute to improving the work environment and student experience. Everyone's input on the CIU team is always considered. No one's suggestions are overlooked. The top pro for me at CIU is one's ability to learn new skills continuously.
cons: The only con is the lack of advancement opportunities.

pros: They have managed to only attract a few hundred desperate suckers seeking to enhance their skills with low quality education.
The students were a joy to work with along with staff members. Programs offered were of high quality and provided real world practical experience.
cons:
Starting at the top, leadership is non-existent. Nepotism is at the core of this organization to start. 
Lots of micromanaging and creating a stressful work environment
The vision of the organization and leadership is again.. non existent 
People at the top who is “leading” needs to reevaluate their core values of what leadership means
Lack of business and knowledge within the field of practice 
Students are just a number are often pressured into signing up for more classes to meet an unrealistic goal and the wrong program.
Employees are underpaid and overworked..  sweatshop mentality.
High turnover... if you aren’t liked... they will find a way to “eliminate” your position.
Overall... just a toxic situation and should be avoided. The pay is not enough to justify mistreatment of their employees.

pros: Creating and maintaing a good work cutlure is actually something the university works on. Team members are supportive of each other and don't have egos, makes it easy to wake up in the morning and get to work on helping students. Especially now with Covid - the univesity still keeps us engaged and connected. Great work by all despite all that is going on. Also love how management treats you like an adult, there's no micro managing and they really let you grow. Also, employees get free tuition, just an added bonus!!
cons: None - excited to grow with the CIU!

pros:
Nice Co Workers
Team spirit Pot luck Lunches Chili cook off party
Fun group training 
And Oh yeah attending the University for free to finish my degree!
3% match on my 401K NICE
